bugs.title: ConnectionHealthMonitor import name collision
bugs.description: ConnectionHealthMonitor is imported from both health_monitor and recovery modules, causing a name collision.
bugs.actual: Compilation error: ConnectionHealthMonitor defined multiple times

bugs.title: SendStream mutable borrow through shared reference
bugs.description: Multiple locations attempt to borrow SendStream mutably through a shared reference after incorrect .clone() calls.
bugs.expected: SendStream should be properly borrowed for writing
bugs.actual: Cannot borrow *send_stream as mutable, as it is behind a & reference
bugs.fix_suggestion: Remove .clone() calls and properly pass &mut SendStream or use Arc<Mutex<SendStream>>

bugs.title: Private field access in ConnectionPool
bugs.description: HealthMonitor attempts to access private 'connections' field of ConnectionPool directly.
bugs.fix_suggestion: Add public getter methods to ConnectionPool or make field public

bugs.title: Use of moved value in async task spawning
bugs.description: peer_id is moved into async closure but then used again after the move.
bugs.expected: peer_id should be available for both async task and HashMap insertion
bugs.fix_suggestion: Clone peer_id before moving: let peer_id_clone = peer_id.clone(); then use in async block

bugs.title: Excessive compiler warnings (55 total)
bugs.description: Large number of unused imports, variables, and dead code warnings across all packages.
bugs.actual: 55 warnings: 25 unused imports, 8 unused variables, 12 dead code
bugs.fix_suggestion: Run 'cargo fix --lib --allow-dirty' to auto-fix most issues
bugs.notes: Code quality issue - should be addressed before release

summary.primary_blocker: landro-quic has 11 compilation errors (4 mutable reference, 2 duplicate methods, 1 missing dependency, 4 config fields)
summary.update: 2025-09-07T01:50:00Z - Detailed analysis reveals 11 specific compilation errors with clear fix instructions
